title: Golden State Warriors lose to Oklahoma City Thunder while LeBron James turn on style for LA Lakers
text:
Golden State Warriors' have now lost two on the spin to start their season after falling to a heavy 120-92 defeat against Oklahoma City Thunder.

Dennis Schroder starred by scoring 22 points to fire Oklahoma City on the way to their first victory of the season - matching their largest margin of victory over the Warriors since the franchise moved from Seattle before the 2008-09 term.

Danilo Gallinari added 21 points for the victors while Shai Gilgeous-Alexander claimed 19 points and nine rebounds.

Dennis Schroder starred for Oklahoma City Thunder as they beat Golden State Warriors

Stephen Curry scored 23 points but couldn't help the Warriors to victory on Sunday night

Warriors have lost two on the spin to start their season but will hope to bounce back quickly

SUNDAY'S NBA SCORES Golden State Warriors 120-92 Oklahoma City Thunder Brooklyn Nets 133-134 Memphis Grizzlies Minnesota Timberwolves 116-109 Miami Heat Dallas Mavericks 119-121 Portland Trail Blazers Los Angeles Lakers 120-101 Charlotte Hornets

Stephen Curry scored 23 points for the Warriors, making seven of his 18 shots while his team-mates made just 23 of 74.

Meanwhile, Anthony Davis and LeBron James stole the show for the Los Angeles Lakers as they overcame Charlotte Hornets 120-101 on Sunday night.

Davis scored a very impressive 29 points and 14 rebounds. James tallied up 20 points, 12 assists and six rebounds for the Lakers, who claimed their second straight victory.

Davis displayed his world-class skills to his new home fans in the first-half by scoring 25 points while James and Dwight Howard took charge after the break.

Howard added 16 points, 10 boards and four blocked shots as he produced an excellent all-round performance.

Remarkably, James hasn't been restricted to under 10 points in a regular-season game since all the way back on January 5, 2007.

LeBron James and Anthony Davis celebrate during their victory over the Charlotte Hornets

Davis scored a very impressive 29 points and 14 rebounds on Sunday night in Los Angeles
description: Golden State Warriors' have now lost two on the spin to start their season after falling to a heavy 120-92 defeat against Oklahoma City Thunder on Sunday night.
